newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Estonian shares buoyant, Hanspank leads.
newsitem.headline: Estonian shares buoyant, Hanspank leads.

text.p: Estonia's share market was buoyant on Friday with Hanspank leading the way and the index rose 2.07 percent to 166.17, dealers said.
"Lots of money is seeking investment opportunities while there is a shortage of sellers," one dealer said, expecting more gains next week.
On the official list, which turned over some 26.7 million kroons, Hanspank was the leading share. It closed half a kroon higher at 161.70 on turnover of 8.5 million kroons.
Elsewhere on the market other banks were also busy.
Tallinna Pank had volume of 8.3 million kroons to close higher at 59.80 kroons versus 57.25.

Forekspank and Estonian Savings bank followed with turnover of five million and three million kroons respectively. Forekspank closed higher at 124.40 kroons against 121.80 and Savings bank went up one kroon to 76.
The over-the-counter market had volume of 9.4 million kroons and Rakvere Meat processing company registered business of 5.9 million. Rakvere closed higher at 11.30 kroons against 9.65.
